Description: Rim and shoulder sherd of Aeolian Wild Goat Style pottery dinos; cream slip; orange fabric with large quantity of gold mica; interior streakily glazed, more dark around mouth; on top of rim hatched maeander pattern with added purple fill; black band on edge of rim; top of wall reserved; below, part of frieze of alternating added purple and black tongues. Drill hole for clay sampling.
Curator's comments: According to NAA analysis carried out on the sherd by Hans Mommsen (Bonn), the vessel falls into chemical group G and hence originated from the region of Aeolis, probably Kyme or Larisa: see Kerschner 2006.
Bibliographic references: Schlotzhauer & Villing 2006 / East Greek Pottery from Naukratis: The Current State of Research (p. 54, Table 1, G (Nauk 13))
Kerschner 2006 / On the Provenance of Aiolian Pottery (p.122 fig.8, sample no. Nauk 13, Appendix 2 Nau14)
Schlotzhauer 2012 / Untersuchungen zur archaischen griechischen Keramik aus Naukratis (p. 76, Nau 6, Pl. 2a-b)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GK.37)
